alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued August 24 at 4:14PM PDT until August 24 at 5:15PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Central Imperial County in southeastern California... * Until 515 PM PDT. * At 414 PM PDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Westmorland to near Holtville to 9 miles east of Calexico, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 35 and 65. CA Route 78 between mile markers 14 and 50. CA Route 111 between mile markers 1 and 37. Locations impacted include... El Centro, Calexico, Brawley, Imperial, Holtville, Westmorland, Calipatria, Bonds Corner, Heber, Alamorio, Glamis and Wiest. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
